preface.title: Preface
preface.para: The FAQ Module is an OTRS extension providing an FAQ or rather a knowledge database.
It facilitates speeding-up the knowledge transfer between agents or (using a public web interface) between organizations and their customers, therefore effectively saving time.
Please contact your commercial support (support@otrs.com) if you have any queries regarding this document or need further information.

sect1.title: FAQ Explorer
sect1.para: Intuitive navigation and flexible mapping of theme hierarchies within the FAQ Explorer enable easy navigation through the database.

sect1.title: WYSIWYG Editor
sect1.para: Using the WYSIWYG Editor you can change the formatting of articles and include screen shots or images.

sect1.title: FAQ articles
sect1.para: FAQ articles with various attributes like "Symptom", "Problem", "Solution", "Title", "Language", "Category", "Keywords", "State", "Created" and "Changed".

sect1.title: FAQ attachments
sect1.para: You can add attachments to FAQ articles, which are available in the customer interface, too (e. g. user guides in pdf format).

sect1.title: Agent and customer interfaces
sect1.para: Using the FAQ state you can determine the interface(s), in which an FAQ article should be displayed. Articles with their state set to "internal" are only visible for agents via the Agent Interface; Articles whose state is set to "external" are also displayed in the protected customer section, and articles tagged as "public" are available in the non-protected public area as well.

sect1.title: Comfortable navigation / clickable keywords
sect1.para: The key words feature enables comfortable navigation to alternative articles using clickable key words.

sect1.title: Linked objects
sect1.para: FAQ articles can be linked to other objects such as tickets, FAQ articles or (CMDB) configuration items.

sect1.title: Full-text and quick search
sect1.para: You can execute a full-text and quick search in the entire knowledge database. You can also use OTRS operators for "AND" or "OR" relations.

sect1.title: Top 10 articles
sect1.para: An overview showing the Top 10 most often accessed, most recently generated and most recently changed articles.

sect1.title: Ranking / Voting of FAQ articles
sect1.para: A personal ranking / voting of FAQ articles providing other users with information about the quality of FAQ articles.

sect1.title: Inserting FAQ articles in OTRS replies
sect1.para: You can insert FAQ articles (without images) in replies you generate in OTRS.

sect1.title: Release workflow
sect1.para: Workflow to release FAQ articles that have been newly generated or changed.

sect1.title: RSS feeds for public FAQ articles
sect1.para: In the public area, an option is provided to subscribe to RSS Feeds providing information about changes in FAQ articles.

sect1.title: OpenSearch format
sect1.para: The FAQ Module supports Open Search format (enabling quick searches directly from the browser).

sect1.title: FAQ connector for public interface
sect1.para: Allow you to use the functions for FAQ public interface via SOAP.

sect1.title: Framework
sect1.para: The following OTRS framework is required:
$Framework

sect1.title: Packages
sect1.para: Following packages are required:
$PackageRequired

sect1.title: Operating system
sect1.para: Following operating systems are to be considered as dependency:
$OS

sect1.title: Third party software
sect1.para: Following software is required for package operation:

chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: The following instructions show how to install the package. Generally, there are two possibilities: You can either use the Admin Interface or the command line.
After having successfully completed the installation, please follow the instructions provided in the chapter "First steps".

sect1.title: Admin Interface
sect1.para: Using the following URL you can install, as well as update or uninstall (if necessary), the package via the Admin Interface (please check whether the user is a member of the Admin Group before starting.)

sect1.title: Command line
sect1.para: Whenever you cannot use the Admin Interface for whatever reason, you may use the following command line tool ("bin/opm.pl") instead.

chapter.title: First steps
chapter.para: As soon as the FAQ Module has been installed, a group "faq" is automatically generated. Access to the FAQ Module is restricted to users with "rw" permission in this group.

sect1.title: Assigning the FAQ authorization
sect1.para: Users with admin rights can add existing agents to the FAQ Group. For the change to be implemented, agents have to re-login after they have been added to the group. Afterwards, an "FAQ" symbol is displayed in their navigation area.

sect1.title: Creating categories
sect1.para: First of all, you have to create FAQ categories.

sect1.title: Creating FAQ articles
sect1.para: Then you can start creating new FAQ articles.

sect1.title: Approval function
sect1.para: The OTRS FAQ has an appoval feature. If you activate the approval feature all newly created FAQs also create a new ticket in a predefined queue. The persons who need to approve the FAQ entries can then act on these tickets and approve the FAQ articles if they see fit. As long as the article has not been approved the article will not be visible in the public interface.
You can activate the Approval function by setting the option FAQ::ApprovalRequired to Yes.

The approval message can be defined under FAQ::ApprovalTicketBody. You can modify the text if you need, and you can also use variables that will be substituted with their actual values when the approval note is generated. The list of the available variables is listed below.

row.entry: Category name of the FAQ article
Category ID of the FAQ article
Item ID of the FAQ article
FAQ Number of the FAQ article

sect1.title: More Configuration Options
sect1.para: There is a group "FAQ" in the Admin area of the SysConfig. Here you can find various configuration options for the FAQ module; most of them are self-explaining.

sect1.title: SOAP Interface for Public FAQ Data
sect1.para: This package provides a SOAP API for accessing the public FAQ data for reading. It has the following operations:

sect2.title: List all FAQ languages
sect2.para: This operation allows you to ask the FAQ module for the current languages available on the system. The operation will return a list of languages including the ID and Name for each language.

sect2.title: List all public FAQ categories
sect2.para: Using this operation you can retrieve all categories with public state on the FAQ module. You are going to get it as a list of categories including ID and Name for each category.

sect2.title: Search for public FAQs
sect2.para: This operation will let you perform a search on the FAQ module for public articles, it will return a list of IDs for matched FAQ articles.

sect2.title: Retrieve public FAQ entries
sect2.para: You can use this operation to easily obtain one or more FAQ articles. You will receive one main data container per each FAQ article, inside each main container you will found one or more containers,the first one contain all data for the FAQ article and the rest, all the attachment files.
Please see the chapter "FAQ connector configuration" below for how to activate the SOAP API on your system, and the chapter "SOAP API Reference" for details on using the SOAP API.

sect1.para: In order to use the web service and the operations included on this package, you should first of all install the web service on your system, using the Command line or taking advance of the Graphical User Interface (Admin Interface). Please note that the old configuration for rpc.pl is not relevant for the GenericInterface and therefore not needed.
The following is an example of how to use Command line to install the web service on the system using the provided YAML file (.yaml) included on this package.
Also you can install the web service importing the mentioned YAML file via web interface on the next URL using the 'Import web service' button on the left side bar.
The content of the YAML file is shown below.

para.screen: --- Debugger: DebugThreshold: debug TestMode: 0 Description: '' Provider: Operation: PublicCategoryList: Description: List all public FAQ categories (with tree information) Type: FAQ::PublicCategoryList LanguageList: Description: List all availables languages Type: FAQ::LanguageList PublicFAQSearch: Description: Search for public FAQs Type: FAQ::PublicFAQSearch PublicFAQGet: Description: Retrieve public FAQ entries Type: FAQ::PublicFAQGet Transport: Config: Encoding: UTF-8 Endpoint: '' MaxLength: 10000000 NameSpace: faq_interface SOAPAction: '' Type: HTTP::SOAP RemoteSystem: ''

sect1.para: In order to use the web service you need to use an new interface in OTRS. As for agents you use index.pl and for customers you use customer.pl, for web services you use nph-genericinterface.pl.

The default and suggested name for this web service is RRZEGIFAQConnector. Since the name of the web service can be changed is very important that you write down the current name of your web service and update it in all locations that access this web service.

When a web service is installed on the system it always has an associated ID number. You can call the web service by name or by ID number. To get the list of valid web services and they corresponding ID number you can use the following command:
For this speific web service, using the default configuration you can call it as follows:

http://localhost/otrs/nph-genericinterface.pl/Webservice/RRZEGIFAQConnector
(by name, recommended) or
http://localhost/otrs/nph-genericinterface.pl/WebserviceID/1
(by ID).
Note: both web service name and ID from the example above could be different in your current environment.

sect1.title: Create links using the category name
sect1.para: To be able to use this feature just replace the CategoryID parameter with Category parameter. Category parameter is the full category path, each sub category is separated by "::". Imagine the following category tree:
To create a link to the "Son" category we need to specify the following path: Category=GrandParent::Parent::Son.
See the link examples below

from:
http://localhost/otrs/index.pl?Action=AdminFAQExplorer;CategoryID=1

to:
http://localhost/otrs/index.pl?Action=AdminFAQExplorer;Category=Misc
Other Examples:

chapter.title: How to use the SOAP API

sect1.title: List all FAQ languages
sect1.para: For this operation is not necessary to send any special parameter to the server, you just need to request the web service directly indicating the "LanguageList" operation on your soap call. The operation will return a list of languages including ID and the Name for each language on the system.
Please see the SOAP call example below:
Example Response:

sect1.title: List all public FAQ categories
sect1.para: For this operation is also not necessary any special parameter, just the simple SOAP call for requesting the web service with the operation name 'PublicCategoryList' as a response you will receive a list of categories including the ID and the Name (long format) for each category.
Please see the SOAP call example below:
Example Response:

sect1.title: Search for public FAQs
sect1.para: For this operation you can specify the following optional parameters: Name, Title, What (full text search), Keyword, LanguageIDs and CategoryIDs to narrow the search results. You may also specify the order of the results by the following parameters: OrderBy and OrderByDirection.
Do a SOAP call for requesting the web service with the operation name 'PublicFAQSearch' as a response you will receive a list of FAQ article IDs.
Note: The full article can be retrieved for each ID by using 'PublicFAQGet' operation separately.
Please see the SOAP call example below:

para.screen: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:urn="urn:examples:faq"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <urn:PublicFAQSearch soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"> <Number>*134*</Number> <!-- Optional --> <Title>*some title*</Title> <!-- Optional --> <What>*some text*</What> <!-- Optional --> <Keyword>*webserver*</Keyword/> <!-- Optional --> <LanguageIDs>1</LanguageIDs> <!-- Optional --> <CategoryIDs>2</CategoryIDs> <!-- Optional --> <OrderBy>FAQID</OrderBy> <!-- Optional --> <OrderByDirection>Up</OrderByDirection> <!-- Optional (Down | Up) --> </urn:PublicFAQSearch> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

sect1.para: Example Response:

sect1.title: Retrieve public FAQ entries
sect1.para: To be able to get one or more FAQ entries, you should send the ItemID(s) as a parameter for the FAQ entry you want to get. You will receive the entire FAQ record with all attachments included if any. Note that attachments will be transferred as base64-encoded strings.
Please see the SOAP call example below:
Example Response:

para.screen: <soap:Envelope soap:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:namesp1="faq_interface" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> <soap:Body> <namesp1:PublicFAQGetResponse> <Item> <Article> <ID>6</ID> <ItemID>6</ItemID> <FAQID>6</FAQID> <Number>10006</Number> <CategoryID>2</CategoryID> <CategoryName>Public</CategoryName> <CategoryShortName>Public</CategoryShortName> <LanguageID>1</LanguageID> <Language>en</Language> <Title>Public2</Title> <Field1>The Symptoms</Field1> <Field2>The Problem</Field2> <Field3>The Solution</Field3> <Field4/> <Field5/> <Field6>The Comments</Field6> <Approved>1</Approved> <Keywords>Keyword1 Keyword2 Keyword3</Keywords> <Votes>1</Votes> <VoteResult>75.00</VoteResult> <StateID>3</StateID> <State>public (all)</State> <StateTypeID>3</StateTypeID> <StateTypeName>public</StateTypeName> <Created>2010-11-02 08:06:43</Created> <CreatedBy>1</CreatedBy> <Changed>2010-11-02 08:06:43</Changed> <ChangedBy>1</ChangedBy> <Name>1288706803-91.878184450707</Name> </Article> <Attachment> <Content>...==</Content> <ContentType>text/plain</ContentType> <Filename>Details.txt</Filename> <Filesize>296</Filesize> </Attachment> <Attachment> <Content>...==</Content> <ContentType>text/plain</ContentType> <Filename>Text.bin</Filename> <Filesize>980</Filesize> </Attachment> </Item> <Item> <Article> <ID>7</ID> <ItemID>7</ItemID> <FAQID>7</FAQID> <Number>10006</Number> <CategoryID>2</CategoryID> <CategoryName>Public</CategoryName> <CategoryShortName>Public</CategoryShortName> <LanguageID>1</LanguageID> <Language>en</Language> <Title>Public777</Title> <Field1>The Symptoms</Field1> <Field2>The Problem</Field2> <Field3>The Solution</Field3> <Field4/> <Field5/> <Field6>The Comments</Field6> <Approved>1</Approved> <Keywords>Keyword1 Keyword2 Keyword3</Keywords> <Votes>1</Votes> <VoteResult>75.00</VoteResult> <StateID>3</StateID> <State>public (all)</State> <StateTypeID>3</StateTypeID> <StateTypeName>public</StateTypeName> <Created>2010-16-03 02:06:43</Created> <CreatedBy>1</CreatedBy> <Changed>2010-11-02 02:06:43</Changed> <ChangedBy>1</ChangedBy> <Name>1288706803-91.878184450707</Name> </Article> </Item> </namesp1:PublicFAQGetResponse> </soap:Body> </soap:Envelope>
